answers.answer: i would personally see a different doctor, he sounds really unprofessional. You should be receiving the best of care, plus extra due to your last pregnancy. Have it out with him, if there is no outcome, see a different doctor. i dont know how it works where you live, im from ireland but i'd definately not be happy. best of luck :)

I would go to someone else, have you had your diabetes test? You should of had a pap test done to test for group b strep, and any sti, or infections, usually the dr after 12 weeks starts making you go for blood tests and urine tests as well. I know mine does. I also get a u/s around 20 weeks too. and one at 12 weeks as well. I would defiantly be looking for someone else who cares about you and your pregnancy, specially if you had complications your last pregnancy. Also your baby wont be to big to find out the sex. I was 33 weeks when i found out what my son was lol.. so i wouldn't worry to much about that

Agree with the others, go somewhere else. What is your OB motivation to wait for so long? You SUPPOSE to have an u/s at 20 weeks where they check all the organs of the baby! Did you have one done at 13 weeks? THat one is mandatory....if not, than your doctor is a joke and you should switch and go for u/s right a way with a different doc!

I also agree with the other ladies and would get another dr for two reasons1). You have a history that puts you in a high risk category so should be monitored a little more closely2). You were told twice you would get an US and didn't.  How incredibly disappointing and without good explanation.

I would go and see someone else. I havent had any other tests other than the ones at 8 weeks...??? I should have my Anti D shot at 28 weeks,,, but I think they'll forget, my midwife cancled on my again 3 weeks in a row!You're at high risk like Spade22 said, and so that needs to be monitored. AND you have been told twice to wait for a US... **** take!xx

Thanks ladies,I will go see another OB ASAP! I thought it was wierd that I hadn't had any blood drawn or been monitored closely. I am on medicade so I know there isn't a limit on the number of US or blood work a doctor can perform. I kept giving him a chance but my unborn child deserves more than that plus I alreadu have two beautiful daughters i need to be well for. So thanks again I will let you know what happens!

Could it be due to your insurance???  Some state insurance or other insurance companies say you can only have one ultra sound that they will pay for.  Maybe your doc thought he was helping you out in waiting, so you could see the sex of the baby.I'm giving him the benifit of doubt.  ask him.
Thats pathetic, I would DEMAND an ultrasound. Wow. Get a new doctor.

Vaccumprincess: The would have told her if it was her insurance and wouldnt p!ss her around.Are you meant to have LOADS of blood tests?? Ive only had the load at 8 weeks!! Ooops!Please see someone else ASAP! :)xx

oh wow; for sure go to another OB. that is ridiculous. it is recommended ALL pregnant women receive an ultrasound at 20 weeks to check for birth defects, genetic diseases, proper development, etc.. i can't believe he wouldn't give you one. its not just to check the sex of the baby. also you should be offered a blood test to screen for some of the genetic problems between....i think ... 16-20 weeks. def def def see another OB. and tell that one you will be leaving his practice.typically gestational diabetics isn't a concern until 28 weeks; hence why they test then. but i wouldn't doubt it if this OB didn't test you.
Everytime I mention the Gestational Diabesties (Sp???) test they dont listen the same with other blood tests.Hmmm.x

As the other ladies have said definitely go see another OB. I've had my urine sample tested at every appointment plus I've had a bunch of bloodwork. I've had two ultrasounds so far and have my 20 week scan in a couple of weeks. You can never be too safe when it comes to your health and baby's health.

If you have had gestational diabetes prior usually they test a little earlier. I would suggest seeing a new OB. Id also let them know why you are leaving the practice so maybe other women can benefit if they do change based on what you say.Good luck!

I would find a different doctor! Routinely you should have had an ultrasound around 8 weeks to date the pregnancy, and then if all was fine at all the follow up appointments then you should have had one between 18-22 weeks for an anatomy screening and at that point they could have told you the sex of the baby.... I would really consider changing.

SEE ANOTHER DOCTOR!  go with your first instinct and run as fast as you can! i'm 11 weeks 2 days and i have an ultrasound in a few days here.  and with my 2 other children ultrasounds at 20weeks...good luck!

I will definitely go see another OB I have already set an appointment with someone else. I knew it was kind of fishy tha everytime I went to see my OB with pains and concerns he would just tell me it would pass. This isn't my first child so I think I would know how NOT to feel. Thanks again everyone and I know for sure it isn't my insurance for those of you that want to know, I am on state funded medicad and it covers numerous labs and ultrasounds up until two months after birth. Thanks agan everyone!

Actually Medicaid only pays for one sonogram unless additional sonograms are needed for medically necessary reasons. With your history I'm sure getting multiple sonograms would be valid for being covered under MC+.So good luck finding a new OB! I would suggest using the site ratemds because other patients have rated them. I would also highly recommend finding a midwife in your area or at least a practice that works with certified nurse midwives (CNMs).

question: I'm currenty 23 weeks pregnant and have been to my dr 6 times. I was expecting an ultrasound to determine the sex of my baby on my 19 week visit but my Dr wanted to wait 4 more weeks. I was fine with it until I went to myappointment yesterday. I was expecting my ultrasound and he told me he wanted to wait 4 more weeks! what's the deal? I haven't had any tests done on me and only had my blood drawn once when I was 8 weeks. Should I be worried ? I have a history of gestational diabetes and had seizures with my last pregnancy. I thought my OB would keep a more watchful eye on this one but nothing so far. I am living in another state than where I had my 2 daughters so this OB is new to me. Should I trust him or go somewhere else?  feel he isn't paying much attention to my pregnancy. I am also scared that the baby will be too big to find out the sex if I keep waiting, Any suggestions on what I can do to receive my ultrasound?
title: 23 weeks and no labs or ultrasounds.... should I worry?
